posts.title: Thread: PR Dashboard
posts.caption:
Built a PR dashboard for @Onde_FRH today.

The problem: managing social content for 3 X accounts (@FreeRiverHouse, @Onde_FRH, @magmatic__) was chaos. Screenshots in chat, "did we post this?", lost approvals.

The solution: 152 lines of Express.js.

üßµ
thread:
Built a PR dashboard for @Onde_FRH today.

The problem: managing social content for 3 X accounts was chaos. Screenshots in chat, "did we post this?", lost approvals.

The solution: 152 lines of Express.js.

üßµ

The stack is dead simple:

- Express server (port 3333)
- JSON file as database
- Static HTML frontend
- Zero auth (it's local)

No React. No database. No deploy.

Just npm start and it works.

Core feature: approve/reject posts with one click.

POST /api/posts/:id/approve
POST /api/posts/:id/reject

The JSON file updates. That's it.

Sometimes the boring solution is the right solution.

Added a feedback system too.

Clients can leave notes on posts. "Change the caption", "Use different image", "Perfect".

All stored in feedback.json.

No Notion. No Slack threads. Just data.

The frontend is a gallery.

Posts displayed like paintings in a museum. Each account gets a section. Approve, reject, add notes.

Built to review on a projector during meetings.

Sometimes UI is just "make it big enough to see".

Total time: 2 hours.
Total lines: 152 (server) + HTML.
Total cost: $0.

It runs on localhost and does exactly what we need.

Shipping tools for yourself is underrated.

Now back to making content worth approving.
posts.source: Real work - Onde PR Dashboard built today

posts.title: Video Generation with Grok
posts.caption:
Generated 4 video clips for a YouTube Short using @grok today.

The workflow:
1. Write prompts for each scene
2. Generate on grok.com/imagine
3. Download clips (~15 sec each)
4. Combine in editor

5MB of watercolor animation. Free.

The Short is "Stella Stellina" - an Italian lullaby from 1920.

AI making videos from public domain poetry. Publishing in 2026.
posts.source: Real work - Video clips generated with Grok
